Ingredients: A large orange, sliced, with the peel still on
A teaspoon or so of cloves
Instructions: Toss everything in a pot and boil it.
Serving suggestion: Serve either hot or cold, or anywhere in between. Strain out the solid parts, but save the orange slices (including the peel) to be snacked on later.
Notes: Using blood oranges instead of oranges might seem like a cool idea, but that turns the cider bitter.
